intro: Mammillaria aurisaeta, commonly known as the aurisaeta hedgehog cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines and small, rounded tubercles. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its desolate appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
